required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Upper Extremity Rehabilitation With the BURT Robotic Arm
clinical_study.official_title: Upper Extremity Rehabilitation With the BURT Robotic Arm: a Feasibility Study

brief_summary.textblock: The overall objective of the proposed study is to carry out usability and design-evaluation assessments of the BURT robotic device for delivering long-term intervention in stroke survivors. The BURT is an upper extremity robotic device that enables the user to see and feel engaging games that encourage intensive therapy. The investigators intend to recruit up to 10 stroke survivors over the course of the study. Participants will train their arm with the BURT for 18 sessions over approximately 6 weeks then participate in a question/answer formatted discussion with research staff to discuss the usability of the device. The investigators will also assess participant's arm function at baseline and after the training sessions.

study_design_info.intervention_model_description: All participants will receive the same intervention

primary_outcome.measure: Changes From Baseline in Fugl-Meyer Upper Extremity Scores
primary_outcome.description: Assessment of upper extremity impairments. Individual items of the scale are summed for a total score ranking from 0 to 66. Higher scores indicate better outcomes.

secondary_outcome.measure: Changes From Baseline in Goal Attainment Scale Scores
secondary_outcome.description: Standardized measure of goals selection and scaling to calculate the extend to which the participant's goals are met. The Goal Attainment Scale ranges from -2 to +2. Positive scores indicates goals are better than expected, score of 0 indicates goals are met and negative scores indicates goals aren't met.

other_outcome.measure: Changes From Baseline in Wolf Motor Function Test Scores (Time Subscale)
other_outcome.description: Assessment of upper-extremity function by the performance time of the Wolf Motor Function Test). The average of the 15 items is reported. The time ranges from 0 to 120 seconds. A decrease in performance time is associated with improved upper-extremity function.

other_outcome.measure: Changes From Baseline in Motor Activity Log Scores
other_outcome.description: Use of upper extremity in daily life. The self-reported amount of use is reported on a scale from 0 to 5. A score of zero is assigned when the hemiparetic side is not used during the activity of daily living, a score of 5 is assigned when the hemiparetic side is used as much as before the stroke. The 30 items of the scale are averaged. Higher scores are a sign of better use in daily life.

other_outcome.measure: Changes From Baseline in Modified Ashworth Scale Scores
other_outcome.description: Assessment of muscle tone for upper extremity muscles. Score rank from 0 (no tone) to 4 (no movement possible). Lower scores indicates a better outcome. Tone at the shoulder and elbow were measured

other_outcome.measure: Changes From Baseline in Articulations Range of Motion
other_outcome.description: Assessment of active arm range of motion with goniometry. Results are reported in degrees and higher ranges include better outcomes.

other_outcome.measure: Changes From Baseline in Manual Muscle Testing Scale Scores
other_outcome.description: Assessment of arm muscle strength using the manual muscle testing scale ranking from 0 (no contraction) to 10 (maximal strength). Higher scores indicate better outcomes.

other_outcome.measure: Changes From Baseline in Wolf Motor Function Test Scores (FAS Subcale)
other_outcome.description: Assessment of upper-extremity function with the Functional ability subscale of the Wolf Motor Function Test. The average of the 15 items is reported. Scores ranges from 0 to 5, they rate the quality of the movement performance. 0= do not attempt, up to 5= identical to contralateral side. Higher scores are associated with better movement quality.

arm_group.arm_group_label: Arm motor function retraining with BURT
arm_group.description: All participants will receive 1 hour sessions, 2-3x/week for 6 weeks (total 18 sessions). Sessions will be organized with 30 minutes of robotic-assisted training and 30 minutes of hands-on training with a research therapist to work on the baseline goals of the subject. Hands-on training will be done with routinely employed techniques in therapy to transfer the skills gained with the robotic device in everyday life activities.

intervention.intervention_name: Arm motor function retraining with BURT
intervention.description: Intervention will be focused on patients impairments to assess the feasibility of the BURT device to carry-on long interventions
intervention.arm_group_label: Arm motor function retraining with BURT

responsible_party.investigator_title: Principal Investigator, Director of the Motion Analysis Laboratory

reported_events.time_frame: We collected information in regard to potential adverse events during the 6 weeks of the study intervention.

certain_agreements.pi_employee: All Principal Investigators ARE employed by the organization sponsoring the study.
certain_agreements.restrictive_agreement: There is NOT an agreement between Principal Investigators and the Sponsor (or its agents) that restricts the PI's rights to discuss or publish trial results after the trial is completed.
